text: José Antonio Romero Morilla (born 11 June 1980) is a Spanish football manager. ==Manager career== Born in La Roda de Andalucía, Seville, Andalusia, Romero made his managerial debuts with Córdoba CF B, after being linked with the club for more than 20 years.José Antonio Romero, un hombre de la confianza de Carlos González (José Antonio Romero, a right-hand man of Carlos González); ABC, 16 March 2015 On 29 June 2006 he was appointed Montilla CF manager,José Antonio Romero, el elegido para el ascenso (José Antonio Romero, the chosen one for the promotion); Minuto 90, 29 June 2006 remaining in charge for three seasons but failing to achieve a promotion. In 2009 Romero returned to Córdoba CF, now named as manager of the youth sides.López Murga confirma la vuelta de José Antonio Romero (López Murga confirms the return of José Antonio Romero); Diario de Córdoba, 25 July 2009 Two years later, after taking the side to an impressive run in Copa del Rey Juvenil, he was appointed director of the youth setup.Romero y la historia épica de un héroe por accidente (Romero and the epic story of a hero by accident); Cordópolis, 6 May 2014 On 15 October 2013 Romero returned to the Verdiblancos' reserve team, replacing fired Pepe Puche.Romero baja al banquillo (Romero descends to the bench); La Segunda B, 15 October 2013 On 16 March 2015, after Miroslav Đukić's dismissal, he was named interim manager of the main squad in La Liga.Comunicado oficial (Official announcement) ; Córdoba's official website, 16 March 2015 Romero appeared in his first professional match on the 22nd, a 1–3 away loss against Real Sociedad.La Real gana por inercia (Real wins by inertia); Marca, 22 March 2015 After failing to win a single match and suffering relegation as dead last, he was relieved from his duties, being named director of the club's Ciudad Deportiva.Carrión dirigirá al filial y Romero la Ciudad Deportiva (Carrión will manage the reserves and Romero the Ciudad Deportiva); Cordópolis, 2 June 2015 ==References== ==External links== * * * Category:1959 births Category:Living people Category:People from Sierra Sur (Seville) Category:Spanish football managers Category:La Liga managers Category:Córdoba CF managers
title: José Antonio Romero Morilla
